pages.text: The eye color of a horse usually depends on it's colors and markings. $(br2)Light-colored horses gain a better chance of having blue or green eyes. Most horses will generally have dark brown, brown, amber, gold, or dark blue eyes. However, all horses still have a very small chance of having blue or green eyes. An even rarer occurrence are two different colored eyes (heterochromia).
Horses with light coats or large, white markings gain better chances of having light eyes.
